response.answer_text: Yes, the jailbreak is reversible. Just connect your iPhone to your lap top and iTunes and update the phones firmware to the latest version, and restore from phone backup. The other way is to, go to settings >general >software update and update the firmware just make sure you are connected to the internet. Just make sure you have uploaded phone back up to the icloud before updating the phone firmware. After the fresh firmware is downloaded on the phone, you will then have to restore the phone from icloud. ***** A WORD OF CAUTION ***** if you are using a jailbreak and then afterward you need to unlock the phone?•••••••• Your phone will lock up. And you might not be able to unlock the phone. Then you have to wait for the next jailbreak release which uses new loopholes to jailbreak and then unlock the phone.

Thanks for A2A. Yes Reversing a Jailbreak is very much possible. To do so just follow the steps listed here. Also do keep in mind following the above method will leave certain “blobs” in your device which though do not cause any harm but if detected while being serviced by Apple Authorised retailers can cause your warranty being void. The only way to remove those is to wipe the device and restore as new. Hope it Helps:)
